text:
London’s biggest beer garden to open this spring in Mile End 
It promises beer, more beer, Lederhosen and bratwurst Wednesday 22 February 2017 13:01 GMT Click to followES Going Out Very German: staff will all be dressed in traditional Bavarian costume 
The biggest beer garden is set to open in Mile End this May as a new German beer festival heads to London for the first time. 
The 2,000-seat, open air ‘Biergarten’ will open April 27 – May 1 and then May 4 – 7 at Mile End Park as part of a traditional German celebration marking the changing of the seasons. 
“We call it frühlingsfest in Germany” said Marvin Kluge, event manager, “That means we celebrate the spring starts and the winter is over. Typically, we do it with beer.” How to tackle a beer festival 
Beer will be served in two-pint steins, staff will all be dressed in traditional Bavarian costume – yes, Lederhosen for men and Dirndl for women – and they promise ‘an authentic eatery experience’, serving up the likes of bratwurst, schnitzel, pretzels, cold meats and cheeses. 
Elsewhere, there will be a beer tent with table service for 1,200, also boasting live music and DJs. Tables can be booked in advance. 
Organisers say the event is family friendly, and there will be German-market style wooden huts selling trinkets, and an activity area with children’s games, including Hau den Lukas, a can knockdown game. Still, if the amusingly boozy video below is anything to go by, it looks as though by the evening, it’s more one just for adults. 
All open-air areas are free entry. For more information, visit bierfest.london More about:
